alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 10:22AM MST until March 23 at 5:34AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along Granite Creek near Prescott in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM MST, Heavy rainfall is combining with already elevated flows in waterways. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bannon Creek, Granite Creek, Willow Creek, Butte Creek and Miller Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott near Granite Creek and White Spar Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 308 and 311...and between mile markers 314 and 315. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
